title: Partial Flipped Learning Course for Advanced Understanding of Microeconomics

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental economics concepts and mathematical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment-driven real-life economic problem-solving competency development in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze local market issues using a supply-demand model and write prediction reports with 80% accuracy.
Learners can compare and evaluate three or more household decision-making cases applying the concept of marginal utility.
Learners can classify imperfect competition market types and write policy proposals using real-world corporate case studies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
